1.text: The proverbs of Solomon: A wise son brings joy to his father, but a foolish son grief to his mother.

2.text: Ill-gotten treasures profit nothing, but righteousness brings deliverance from death.

3.text: The LORD does not let the righteous go hungry, but He denies the craving of the wicked.

4.text: Idle hands make one poor, but diligent hands bring wealth.

5.text: He who gathers in summer is a wise son, but he who sleeps during harvest is a disgraceful son.

6.text: Blessings are on the head of the righteous, but the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.

7.text: The memory of the righteous is a blessing, but the name of the wicked will rot.

8.text: A wise heart will receive commandments, but foolish lips will come to ruin.

9.text: He who walks in integrity walks securely, but he who perverts his ways will be found out.

10.text: He who winks the eye causes grief, and foolish lips will come to ruin.

11.text: The mouth of the righteous is a fountain of life, but the mouth of the wicked conceals violence.

12.text: Hatred stirs up dissension, but love covers all transgressions.

13.text: Wisdom is found on the lips of the discerning, but a rod is for the back of him who lacks judgment.

14.text: The wise store up knowledge, but the mouth of the fool invites destruction.

15.text: The wealth of the rich man is his fortified city, but poverty is the ruin of the poor.

16.text: The labor of the righteous leads to life, but the gain of the wicked brings punishment.

17.text: Whoever heeds instruction is on the path to life, but he who ignores reproof goes astray.

18.text: The one who conceals hatred has lying lips, and whoever spreads slander is a fool.

19.text: When words are many, sin is unavoidable, but he who restrains his lips is wise.

20.text: The tongue of the righteous is choice silver, but the heart of the wicked has little worth.

21.text: The lips of the righteous feed many, but fools die for lack of judgment.

22.text: The blessing of the LORD enriches, and He adds no sorrow to it.

23.text: The fool delights in shameful conduct, but a man of understanding has wisdom.

24.text: What the wicked man dreads will overtake him, but the desire of the righteous will be granted.

25.text: When the whirlwind passes, the wicked are no more, but the righteous are secure forever.

26.text: Like vinegar to the teeth and smoke to the eyes, so is the slacker to those who send him.

27.text: The fear of the LORD prolongs life, but the years of the wicked will be cut short.

28.text: The hope of the righteous is joy, but the expectations of the wicked will perish.

29.text: The way of the LORD is a refuge to the upright, but destruction awaits those who do evil.

30.text: The righteous will never be shaken, but the wicked will not inhabit the land.

31.text: The mouth of the righteous brings forth wisdom, but a perverse tongue will be cut out.

32.text: The lips of the righteous know what is fitting, but the mouth of the wicked is perverse.
